name: Sunday Brunch: Quick Cinnamon Buns
description: [Photo: Robin Bellinger] I have a strange fixation with this recipe. It was the first thing I made from The America's Test Kitchen Family Cookbook, and it was perfect—fast, heavenly cinnamon rolls from my own oven. But when I tried...
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 cups flour, plus extra for the counter

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°. Make the filling: stir together the brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, cinnamon, cloves, salt, and 1 tablespoon melted butter until the mixture resembles wet sand.

Press the dough out into a 9 by 12 inch rectangle using your hands. Brush the dough with 2 tablespoons melted butter and sprinkle evenly with the filling, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Press the filling firmly into the dough.
Turn the buns out onto a greased wire rack and then turn right side up. Let cool for at least 5 minutes while you make the glaze.
Whisk buttermilk into the powdered sugar until you have a glaze that tastes balanced to you. Whisk until smooth and drizzle over the rolls.

To make 8 pull-apart rolls as in the original recipe: In step 4, slice the dough into 8 pieces, not 12. Put the slices in a greased 9-inch round cake pan, preferably nonstick. Sprinkle over any lost filling and drizzle with butter. Bake 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.
